title: Pink Floyd - The Wall: The Demos
description:
This is the real deal. In 1978, Roger Waters sat down and began writing and recording what would become one of Pink Floyd&#039;s most iconic albums of all time, "The Wall". The songs on this complete demo collection were allegedly recorded on a 4-Track recorder. Most guitar, bass, drum and vocal parts were recorded by Waters, with the occasional collaboration of David Gilmour.

Again, this is ACTUALLY real. A co-worker of mine found it in the form of a burned CD being sold at a second-hand record store. The sound quality is so-so even though it&#039;s encoded at 320kbps. It WAS recorded on home equipment, after all.

2.  The Thin Ice
3.  Another Brick in the Wall (Part 1)
4.  The Happiest Days of Our Lives

10. One of My Turns
11. Don&#039;t Leave Me Now
12. Empty Spaces (Part 2)
13. What Shall We Do Now?
14. Another Brick in the Wall (Part 3)
15. Goodbye Cruel World
